summary: The Baltic Security Assessment Act of 2025 mandates the Secretary of State, in collaboration with the Secretary of Defense, to submit a report to Congress detailing emerging threats to Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania. The report will analyze military, cyber, hybrid, and political threats, assess the roles of malign actors, evaluate current US/NATO presence, explore defense cooperation opportunities, and recommend measures to strengthen the Baltic countries' deterrence, cybersecurity, and democratic resilience. The bill emphasizes the importance of these nations to US national security.
